properties.Verse: "Yo, sometime I sit back, reflect on the place that I live at Unlike any place I ever been at The home of big gats, deep dish hammer rim caps Have a mishap, push ya wig back Where you go to get the fresh trim at Fulton and Jay got the Timb rack Blue collars metro carding it Thugs mobbing it, form partnership Increase armament, street pharmacist Deep consequence, when you seek sleek ornaments"
properties.Embed Link: src="https://embed.tidal.com/tracks/569765" width="500" height="120" allow="encrypted-media" sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-forms allow-popups" title="TIDAL Embed Player"
properties.Description: Fulton street was a center for hip-hop culture and commerce etc.

properties.Verse: "I'm here to talk about the Albee Square Mall  A place where people shop in Downtown Brooklyn  Where I can be found if you’re lookin..."
properties.Description: Mall also referenced by Jay-Z and others

properties.Verse: "Pull the truck up, front and roll up the next blunt So we can steam on the way to the telly go fill my belly A T bone steak, cheese eggs and Welch's grape Conversate for a few 'cause in a few, we gon' do What we came to do, ain't that right boo"
properties.Description: Meal referenced by Notorious BIG in Big Poppa - one of favorite restaurants

properties.Verse: "I'm from where the hammers rung, news cameras never come  You and your mans hung in every verse in your rhyme  Where the grams was slung, niggas vanish every summer  When the blue vans would come, we throw the work in the can and run  Where the plans was to get funds and skate off the set  To achieve this goal quicker, sold all my weight wet  Faced with immeasurable odds, still I gave straight bets...  [Chorus] Cough up a lung, where I'm from, Marcy son, ain't nothing nice"

"I'm blacker than midnight on Broadway and Myrtle Hip-Hop passed all your tall social hurdles Like the nationwide projects-prison-industry complex Working-class poor: better keep your alarm set Streets too loud to ever hear freedom ring Say evacuate your sleep, it's dangerous to dream"

"Comin' live from Flatbush Junction and making it hard to function Breakin' down your sound systems and governmental corruption So, step aside pumpkin, quit jumpin' to assumptions The illest cats to ever rap, we spittin' crack on beats and claps Salvations? Ain't 'nything, I make that up for simple tracks"

"Celebratin' every day, no more public housin' Thinkin' back on my one-room shack Now my mom pimps a Ac' with minks on her back And she loves to show me off of course Smiles every time my face is up in The Source We used to fuss when the landlord dissed us No heat, wonder why Christmas missed us Birthdays was the worst days Now we sip Champagne when we thirsty"
"We used to chill at Nkiru  her moms was a customer She used to love to buy the books  by Octavia Butler."
properties.Album: Right About Now: The Official Sucka Free Mix CD
properties.Description: Mos Def & Talib Kweli co-owned bookstore - original location at 76 St Mark's Ave. first black bookstore in brooklyn and 2nd in NYC. moved in 2000 when bought out by the pair - now online bookstore.
